thread.title: Friends recreate Karen Matthews drama The Moorside
thread.title_full: Friends recreate Karen Matthews drama The Moorside

title: Friends recreate Karen Matthews drama The Moorside
text: comments A group of friends have gone viral after their bizarre recreation of BBC drama The Moorside was viewed by more than a million people online. The two-part series which aired earlier this month retold the story of Karen Matthews faking the kidnapping of her daughter Shannon, which led to her being vilified across the nation. But Jess Wall, her partner's mother and another friend were tickled by some of the characters on the show and decided to make a video after Dave Roberts nailed an impression of Shannon's step-dad, Craig Meehan. Scroll down for video. The scene involves Julie, played by Mandy Farr, shouting at Karen (Jess Wall, after finding out the kidnapping was staged As well as Miss Wall - who played Karen - and Mr Roberts, the cast was completed by the Mandy Farr, who took on the role of Karen's friend Julie. The scene involves Julie shouting at Karen after finding out the kidnapping was staged, before focus turns to Craig, who is sat on the sofa drinking Calpol. The clip then finishes with a recreation of a real-life press conference in which Karen held up a teddy bear and begged her daughter to come home. Miss Wall, 26, told MailOnline: 'I followed the case very closely at the time and could not believe it, but then when I watched the programme I could not believe even more what these people are actually like like. Focus turns to Craig (Dave Roberts), who is sat on the sofa drinking Calpol, and the clip then finishes with a recreation of a real-life press conference in which Karen held up a teddy bear and begged her daughter to come home 'Dave was pulling off the step-dad really well so we thought we would film it and send it to a few friends, because I know a lot of people who were watching it. 'I thought it was so funny how well they all picked up the characters, so we just went with it.' After being posted on Saturday night, the video quickly received around 50 likes, but it kept growing and now has around 12,000, as well as 14,000 comments. Miss Wall added that her phone kept freezing because of the notifications, but has never taken on dramatic scenes before and is not sure she will do so again in the future. RELATED ARTICLES
